Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Mueller met the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. Mueller was absent for 1146 days and present for only 314 days during the four years preceding his application
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application initially approved despite insufficient residency
Remedy_Requested: Minister's appeal to set aside the decision
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge failed to adequately apply the Re Koo test
Assessment_Factor: Application of the Re Koo test for residency
Procedural_Issue: Referral back to a different Citizenship Judge for re-determination
Evidence_Used: Record of absences and presences in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Duration and pattern of physical presence in Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturn of approval and reassessment of eligibility
Governing_Rule: Re Koo test for determining residency
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to address key factors in residency analysis
Outcome: Appeal successful; case remitted for re-determination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of granting citizenship to ineligible applicant
Cause_Description: Mr. Mueller's citizenship approved despite not meeting 1095-day residency requirement
Residency_Compliance: Not met (314 days present out of required 1095)
Evidence_Assessment: Judge did not properly assess presence/absence patterns
Decision_Rationale: Judge demonstrated lack of understanding of law and facts
Evidentiary_Issues: Incomplete application of legal test to factual record
